description: Unique surrogate key for this schedule occurrence record.
Boolean flag indicating whether a work order should be created from this scheduled occurrence.
Flag indicating a warranty exception was created for this occurrence; likely used when scheduling impacts warranty coverage; confirm with SME.
Planned due date/time for the scheduled maintenance occurrence.
Identifier of the maintenance schedule definition that generated this occurrence.
Identifier linking the schedule to a specific asset and procedure instance that produced this occurrence; confirm exact relationship with SME.
Identifier of the asset to be serviced by this schedule.
Location or site of the asset at the time of scheduling, for routing and reporting.
Asset class or group associated to aid scheduling, filtering, or reporting; may be blank.
Identifier of the maintenance procedure or PM task to be performed.
Category of the procedure (e.g., preventive, inspection, corrective); confirm allowed values with SME.
Planner-set priority for the scheduled work, used to sequence or dispatch tasks.
System-derived priority based on rules such as due date, criticality, or meter proximity; may override or complement manual priority.
Project or job code to associate costs and progress from this scheduled work.
General ledger account or cost center to which work costs will be posted.
Supervisor responsible for overseeing or approving this scheduled work.
Work shift associated with performing the scheduled task.
Meter reading threshold at which the task becomes due (e.g., mileage, hours).
Identifier of the work order created from this scheduling event, if generated.
Code indicating the trigger or source of the schedule (e.g., time-based, meter-based, manual); confirm code meanings with SME.
User associated with the latest update to this record (legacy/general field); confirm whether it reflects creator or last modifier.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this record.
Type of meter used for scheduling (e.g., hours, miles), referencing a meter definition.
User who assigned the resulting work to a person or team.
User, crew, or team assigned to perform the work.
Timestamp of the last user-initiated modification captured by the application; may mirror the system last-modified time.
User who created this schedule occurrence record.
Timestamp when this record was created.
User who most recently modified this record.
Timestamp of the most recent modification to this record.
